p: The free radical scavenging rate was determined by measuring the 2,2-diphenyl-1-picrylhydrazyl (DPPH) with L-ascorbic acid as a reference standard. For the DPPH assay, we used a modified procedure described in a previous study [ 27]. The lyophilized powder extract from Hericium erinaceus was dissolved in methanol (2 mL extracts and 2 mL Tris-HCl buffer) and mixed with 260 μL of a 0.2 mM DPPH radical solution (Sigma-Aldrich, St. Louis, MO, USA). The percentage inhibition was calculated according to the formula [(A 0 − A 1)/A 0] × 100, where A 0 is the absorbance of the control and A 1 is the absorbance of the sample.
